sections.instruction: Complete the notes below. Write ONE WORD AND/OR A NUMBER for each answer.

questions.question: Granary Cottage: available for week beginning ______ May
Granary Cottage: cost for the week: £ ______
Name of second cottage: ______ Cottage
Building was originally a ______
Walk through doors from living room into a ______
Several ______ spaces at the front
Central heating and stove that burns ______
Views of old ______ from living room
View of hilltop ______ from the bedroom
Deadline for final payment: end of ______

sections.sectionTitle: Local council report on traffic and highways

questions.question: A survey found people’s main concern about traffic in the area was
options: changes in the type of traffic.

questions.question: Which change will shortly be made to the cycle path next to the river?
Plans for a pedestrian crossing have been postponed because
options: funding is not available at present.

questions.question: On Station Road, notices have been erected
options: telling cyclists not to leave their bikes outside the station ticket office.
asking motorists to switch off engines when waiting at the level crossing.
warning pedestrians to leave enough time when crossing the railway line.

questions.question:
Label the map below.

Write the correct letter, A-I, next to Questions 15-20.
New car park
New cricket pitch
Children's playground
Skateboard ramp
Pavilion
Notice board
Which TWO benefits of city bike-sharing schemes do the students agree are the most important? (Choose TWO)
Which TWO things do the students think are necessary for successful bike-sharing schemes? (Choose TWO)
options: Bikes should have a GPS system.
The app should be easy to use.
Only one scheme should be available.
There should be a large network of cycle lanes.

questions.question:
What is the speakers' opinion of the bike-sharing schemes in each of the following cities?

Choose SIX answers from the box and write the correct letter, A-G, next to Questions 25-30.

Opinion of bike-sharing scheme

A   They agree it has been disappointing.

B   They think it should be cheaper.

C   They are surprised it has been so successful.

D   They agree that more investment is required.

E   They think the system has been well designed.

F   They disagree about the reasons for its success.

G   They think it has expanded too quickly.

Cities are given below:
25   Amsterdam                …………….
26   Dublin                          …………….
27   London                        …………….
28   Buenos Aires             …………….
29   New York                    …………….
30   Sydney                         …………….

sections.sectionTitle: The Extinction of the Dodo Bird
sections.instruction: Complete the notes below. Write ONE WORD ONLY for each answer.

questions.question: 1507 – Portuguese ships transporting ______ stopped at the island.
1638 – The Dutch established a ______ on the island.
A Dutch painting suggests the dodo was very ______.
The only remaining soft tissue is a dried ______.
Recent studies of a dodo skeleton suggest the birds were capable of rapid ______.
It’s thought they were able to use their small wings to maintain ______.
Their ______ was of average size.
Their sense of ______ enabled them to find food.
______ also escaped onto the island and ate the birds’ eggs.
The arrival of farming meant the ______ was destroyed.
